snippet: On the eve of negotiations to end the conflict in the country, rebel forces took major sections of Bor, giving them a foothold for a possible march toward the capital.
abstract: Rebel forces in South Sudan seize major sections of city Bor, giving them a strategic foothold for a possible march toward capital Juba; development comes on eve of negotiations to end country's conflict; fighting between government troops and rebel forces has driven an estimated 180,000 people from their homes, forcing them to seek shelter in more than a dozen United Nations compounds across the country.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH
byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish reported from Awerial, and Isma’il Kushkush from Khartoum, Sudan. Benno Muchler contributed reporting from Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

lead_paragraph: On the eve of negotiations to end the conflict in the country, rebel forces took major sections of Bor, giving them a foothold for a possible march toward the capital.

headline.main: Rebels Seize Portions of Strategic City in South Sudan
headline.print_headline: Rebels Seize Portions of Strategic City in South Sudan
